title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. tit. 12, ch. V, subch. H, art. 1, pt. 359 - Employees Who Are Eligible For Benefits Provided By Their Employers
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. tit. 12, ch. V, subch. H, art. 1, pt. 359 - Employees Who Are Eligible For Benefits Provided By Their Employers

State Regulations
§ 359.1 - Disabilities on or after july 1, 1950
§ 359.2 - Employees who acquire eligibility during employment
§ 359.3 - Employees who acquire eligibility on return to work after unemployment
§ 359.4 - Effect of disability on eligibility for benefits to be provided by employer
§ 359.5 - Waiver under section 235 of the workers' compensation law

Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. tit. 12, ch. V, subch. H, art. 1, pt. 359

Statutory authority: Workers' Compensation Law, §§ 117, 141, 241

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
